Name: Abacus
Entries1: A standard tool used to make calculations.

Name: Acid (vial)
Entries1: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

Name: Alchemist’s fire (flask)
Entries1: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

Name: Antitoxin (vial)
Entries1: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

Name: Backpack
Entries1: A backpack is a leather pack carried on the back, typically with straps to secure it. A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

Name: Ball bearings (bag o f 1,000)
Entries1: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

Name: Barrel
Entries1: A barrel can hold 40 gallons of liquid, or 4 cubic feet of solid material.

Name: Basket
Entries1: A basket can hold 2 cubic feet/40 pounds of gear.

Name: Bedroll
Entries1: You never know where you’re going to sleep, and a bedroll helps you get better sleep in a hayloft or on the cold ground. A bedroll consists of bedding and a blanket thin enough to be rolled up and tied. In an emergency, it can double as a stretcher.

Name: Bell
Entries1: A standard bell that rings, typically used for signaling.

Name: Bit and Bridle
Entries1: Standard equipment used to direct a mount.

Name: Blanket
Entries1: A thick, quilted, blanket made to keep you warm in cold weather.

Name: Block and tackle
Entries1: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to objects, a block and tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

Name: Book
Entries1: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

Name: Bottle, glass
Entries1: A bottle can hold 1 1/2 pints of liquid.

Name: Bucket
Entries1: A bucket can hold 3 gallons of liquid, or 1/2 cubic foot of solid material.

Name: Caltrops (bag of 20)
Entries1: As an action, you can spread a bag of caltrops to cover a square area that is 5 feet on a side. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. Taking this damage reduces the creature's walking speed by 10 feet until the creature regains at least 1 hit point. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

Name: Candle
Entries1: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

Name: Case, crossbow bolt
Entries1: This wooden case can hold up to twenty crossbow bolts.

Name: Case, map or scroll
Entries1: This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up sheets of paper or five rolled-up sheets of parchment.

Name: Chain (10 feet)
Entries1: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

Name: Chalk (1 piece)
Entries1: A piece of chalk used for writing and marking on various surfaces.

Name: Chest
Entries1: A chest can hold 12 cubic feet/ 300 pounds of gear.

Name: Climber's kit
Entries1: A climber's kit includes special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. You can use the climber's kit as an action to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the point where you anchored yourself, and you can't climb more than 25 feet away from that point without undoing the anchor.

Name: Clothes, common
Entries1: This set of clothes could consist of a loose shirt and baggy breeches, or a loose shirt and skirt or overdress. Cloth wrappings are used for shoes.

Name: Clothes, costume
Entries1: This set of clothes is fashioned after a particular costume, typically meant for entertaining.

Name: Clothes, fine
Entries1: This set of clothes is designed specifically to be expensive and to show it, including fancy, tailored clothes in whatever fashion happens to be the current style in the courts of the nobles. Precious metals and gems could be worked into the clothing.

Name: Clothes, traveler’s
Entries1: This set of clothes could consist of boots, a wool skirt or breeches, a sturdy belt, a shirt (perhaps with a vest or jacket), and an ample cloak with a hood.

Name: Component pouch
Entries1: A component pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).

Name: Crowbar
Entries1: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

Name: Feed (per day)
Entries1: Standard feed typically consumed by a mount per day.

Name: Fishing tackle
Entries1: This kit includes a wooden rod, silken line, corkwood bobbers, steel hooks, lead sinkers, velvet lures, and narrow netting.

Name: Flask or tankard
Entries1: A flask or tankard can hold 1 pint of liquid.

Name: Grappling hook
Entries1: When tied to the end of a rope, a grappling hook can secure the rope to a battlement, window ledge, tree limb, or other protrusion.

Name: Hammer
Entries1: This one-handed hammer with an iron head is useful for pounding pitons into a wall.

Name: Hammer, sledge
Entries1: This two-handed, iron-headed hammer is good for smashing open treasure chests.

Name: Healer’s kit
Entries1: This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

Name: Holy water (flask)
Entries1: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a target creature, treating the holy water as an improvised weapon. If the target is a fiend or undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage.
Entries2: A cleric or paladin may create holy water by performing a special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

Name: Hourglass
Entries1: A standard hourglass used to measure the passage of time.

Name: Hunting trap
Entries1: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

Name: Ink (1 ounce bottle)
Entries1: Ink is typically used with an ink pen to write.

Name: Ink pen
Entries1: An ink pen is a wooden stick with a special tip on the end. The tip draws ink in when dipped in a vial and leaves an ink trail when drawn across a surface.

Name: Jug or pitcher
Entries1: A jug or pitcher can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

Name: Ladder (10-foot)
Entries1: This item is a straight, simple wooden ladder.

Name: Lamp
Entries1: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

Name: Lantern, bullseye
Entries1: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

Name: Lantern, hooded
Entries1: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

Name: Lock
Entries1: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Your DM may decide that better locks are available for higher prices.

Name: Magnifying glass
Entries1: This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires. Lighting a fire with a magnifying glass requires light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite. A magnifying glass grants advantage on any ability check made to appraise or inspect an item that is small or highly detailed.

Name: Manacles
Entries1: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

Name: Mess kit
Entries1: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

Name: Mirror, steel
Entries1: A steel mirror is handy when you want to look around corners, signal friends with reflected sunlight, keep an eye on a medusa, make sure that you look good enough to present yourself to the queen, or examine wounds that you’ve received on hard-to-see parts of your body.

Name: Oil (flask)
Entries1: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Name: Paper (one sheet)
Entries1: A sheet of standard paper is made from cloth fibers.

Name: Parchment (one sheet)
Entries1: A sheet of parchment is a piece of goat hide or sheepskin that has been prepared for writing on.

Name: Perfume (vial)
Entries1: A fragrant commodity typically used by the wealthy.

Name: Pick, miner’s
Entries1: A miner's pick is designed to concentrate the force of its blow on a small area.

Name: Piton
Entries1: When a wall doesn’t offer handholds and footholds, you can make your own. A piton is a steel spike with an eye through which you can loop a rope.

Name: Pole (10-foot)
Entries1: When you suspect a trap, you can put the end of your 10-foot pole through that hole in the wall instead of reaching in with your hand.

Name: Pot, iron
Entries1: An iron pot can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

Name: Pouch
Entries1: A cloth or leather pouch can hold 1/5 cubic foot/ 6 pounds of gear - or up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch.

Name: Quiver
Entries1: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

Name: Ram, portable
Entries1: You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

Name: Rations (1 day)
Entries1: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Name: Robes
Entries1: A standard set of robes.

Name: Rope, hempen (50 feet)
Entries1: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Name: Rope, silk (50 feet)
Entries1: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Name: Sack
Entries1: A sack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear.

Name: Scale, merchant’s
Entries1: A scale includes a small balance, pans, and a suitable assortment of weights up to 2 pounds. With it, you can measure the exact weight of small objects, such as raw precious metals or trade goods, to help determine their worth.

Name: Sealing wax
Entries1: When you press a signet ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

Name: Shovel
Entries1: A standard shovel used for digging.

Name: Signal whistle
Entries1: A small whistle used for signaling.

Name: Signet ring
Entries1: Each signet ring has a distinctive design carved into it. When you press this ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

Name: Soap
Entries1: A commodity used for bathing.

Name: Spellbook
Entries1: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

Name: Spikes, iron (10)
Entries1: Standard iron spikes typically used with a hammer.

Name: Spyglass
Entries1: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

Name: Tent, two-person
Entries1: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

Name: Tinderbox
Entries1: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch -- or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel -- takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Name: Torch
Entries1: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

Name: Vial
Entries1: A vial can hold 4 ounces of liquid.

Name: Waterskin (full)
Entries1: A waterskin can hold 4 pints of liquid.

Name: Whetstone
Entries1: A standard whetstone used to sharpen blades.

Name: Arrow
Entries1: Arrows are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

Name: Arrows (20)
Entries1: Arrows are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

Name: Blowgun Needle
Entries1: Blowgun needles are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

Name: Blowgun Needles (50)
Entries1: Blowgun needles are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

Name: Crossbow Bolt
Entries1: Crossbow bolts are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

Name: Crossbow Bolts (20)
Entries1: Crossbow bolts are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

Name: Sling Bullet
Entries1: Sling bullets are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

Name: Sling Bullets (20)
Entries1: Sling bullets are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

Name: Crystal
Entries1: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Orb
Entries1: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Rod
Entries1: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Wand
Entries1: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Alchemist’s supplies
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Brewer’s supplies
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Calligrapher's supplies
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Carpenter’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Cartographer’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Cobbler’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Cook’s utensils
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Disguise kit
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Forgery kit
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Glassblower’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Herbalism kit
Entries1: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create antitoxin and any potion of healing.

Name: Jeweler’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Leatherworker’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Mason’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Navigator’s tools
Entries1: This set of instruments is used for navigation at sea. Proficiency with navigator's tools lets you chart a ship's course and follow navigation charts. In addition, these tools allow you to add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to avoid getting lost at sea.

Name: Painter’s supplies
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Poisoner’s kit
Entries1: A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft or use poisons.

Name: Potter’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Smith’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Thieves’ tools
Entries1: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

Name: Tinker’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Weaver’s tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Woodcarver's tools
Entries1: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Name: Sprig of mistletoe
Entries1: A druid can use a Sprig of Mistletoe (or holly) as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Totem
Entries1: A druid can use a Totem as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Yew wand
Entries1: A druid can use a Yew Wand as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Alexandrite
Entries1: A transparent dark green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

Name: Amber
Entries1: A transparent watery gold to rich gold gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Amethyst
Entries1: A transparent deep purple gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Aquamarine
Entries1: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Azurite
Entries1: An opaque mottled deep blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Banded agate
Entries1: A translucent striped brown, blue, white, or red gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Black opal
Entries1: A translucent dark green with black mottling and golden flecks gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

Name: Black pearl
Entries1: An opaque pure black gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Black sapphire
Entries1: A translucent lustrous black gemstone with glowing highlights worth 5,000 gold pieces.

Name: Bloodstone
Entries1: An opaque dark gray gemstone with red flecks worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Blue quartz
Entries1: A transparent pale blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Blue sapphire
Entries1: A transparent blue-white to medium blue gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Blue spinel
Entries1: A transparent deep blue gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

Name: Carnelian
Entries1: An opaque orange to red-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Chalcedony
Entries1: An opaque white gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Chrysoberyl
Entries1: A translucent light green, deep green, or white gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Chrysoprase
Entries1: A translucent green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Citrine
Entries1: A transparent pale yellow-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Coral
Entries1: An opaque crimson gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Diamond
Entries1: A transparent blue-white, canary, pink, brown, or blue gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces.

Name: Emerald
Entries1: A transparent deep bright green gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

Name: Eye agate
Entries1: A translucent gemstone with circles of gray, white, brown, blue, or green worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Fire opal
Entries1: A translucent fiery red Gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Garnet
Entries1: A transparent red, brown-green, or violet gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Hematite
Entries1: An opaque gray-black gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Jacinth
Entries1: A transparent fiery orange gem worth 5,000 gold pieces

Name: Jade
Entries1: A translucent light green, deep green, or white gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Jasper
Entries1: An opaque blue, black, or brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Jet
Entries1: An opaque deep black gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Lapis lazuli
Entries1: An opaque light and dark blue gemstone with yellow flecks worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Malachite
Entries1: An opaque striated light and dark green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Moonstone
Entries1: A translucent white gemstone with a pale blue glow worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Moss agate
Entries1: A translucent gemstone with pink or yellow-white with mossy gray or green markings worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Obsidian
Entries1: An opaque black gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Onyx
Entries1: An opaque gemstone with bands of black and white, or pure black or white worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Opal
Entries1: A translucent pale blue with green and golden mottling gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

Name: Pearl
Entries1: An opaque lustrous white, yellow, or pink gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Peridot
Entries1: A transparent rich olive green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

Name: Quartz
Entries1: A transparent white, smoky gray, or yellow gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

Name: Rhodochrosite
Entries1: An opaque light pink gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Ruby
Entries1: A transparent clear red to deep crimson gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces

Name: Sardonyx
Entries1: An opaque gemstone with bands of red and white worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Spinel
Entries1: A transparent gemstone of red, red-brown, or deep green worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Star rose quarts
Entries1: A translucent rosy Gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Star ruby
Entries1: A translucent ruby gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Star sapphire
Entries1: A translucent blue sapphire gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Tiger eye
Entries1: A translucent brown gemstone with a golden center worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Topaz
Entries1: A transparent golden yellow gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

Name: Tourmaline
Entries1: A transparent pale green, blue, brown, or red gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

Name: Turquoise
Entries1: An opaque light blue-green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

Name: Yellow sapphire
Entries1: A transparent fiery yellow or yellow-green gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

Name: Zircon
Entries1: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Dice set
Entries1: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

Name: Dragonchess set
Entries1: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

Name: Playing card set
Entries1: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

Name: Three-Dragon Ante set
Entries1: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

Name: Chain Mail
Entries1: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Plate Armor
Entries1: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Name: Ring Mail
Entries1: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

Name: Splint Armor
Entries1: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

Name: Amulet
Entries1: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

Name: Emblem
Entries1: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

Name: Reliquary
Entries1: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

Name: Bagpipes
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Drum
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Dulcimer
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Flute
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Horn
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Lute
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Lyre
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Pan flute
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Shawm
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Viol
Entries1: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Leather Armor
Entries1: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Name: Padded Armor
Entries1: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

Name: Studded Leather Armor
Entries1: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Name: Breastplate
Entries1: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Name: Chain Shirt
Entries1: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Name: Half Plate Armor
Entries1: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

Name: Hide Armor
Entries1: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

Name: Scale Mail
Entries1: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Spiked Armor
Entries1: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.

Name: Battleaxe
Entries1: Proficiency with a battleaxe allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Club
Entries1: Proficiency with a club allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Dagger
PropertyList: F, L, T, ME, SIM, RA
Entries1: Proficiency with a dagger allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Double-Bladed Scimitar
Entries1: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4.

Name: Flail
Entries1: Proficiency with a flail allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Glaive
Entries1: Proficiency with a glaive allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Greataxe
Entries1: Proficiency with a greataxe allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Greatclub
Entries1: Proficiency with a greatclub allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Greatsword
Entries1: Proficiency with a greatsword allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Halberd
Entries1: Proficiency with a halberd allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Handaxe
Entries1: Proficiency with a handaxe allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Hooked Shortspear
Entries1: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

Name: Javelin
Entries1: Proficiency with a javelin allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Lance
Entries1: Proficiency with a lance allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.
Entries2: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

Name: Light Hammer
Entries1: Proficiency with a light hammer allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Longsword
Entries1: Proficiency with a longsword allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Mace
Entries1: Proficiency with a mace allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Maul
Entries1: Proficiency with a maul allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Morningstar
Entries1: Proficiency with a morningstar allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Pike
Entries1: Proficiency with a pike allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Quarterstaff
Entries1: Proficiency with a quarterstaff allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Rapier
Entries1: Proficiency with a rapier allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Scimitar
Entries1: Proficiency with a scimitar allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Shortsword
Entries1: Proficiency with a shortsword allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Sickle
Entries1: Proficiency with a sickle allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Spear
Entries1: Proficiency with a spear allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Staff
Entries1: Staffs are sometimes wielded by Wizards as spellcasting focus, but they pack a wallop when swung right.

Name: Trident
Entries1: Proficiency with a trident allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: War Pick
Entries1: Proficiency with a war pick allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Warhammer
Entries1: Proficiency with a warhammer allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Whip
Entries1: Proficiency with a whip allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Wooden Staff
Entries1: A druid can use a Wooden Staff as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

Name: Yklwa
Entries1: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

Name: Back Sap
Entries1: This tarry substance harvested from the dark boughs of the death’s head willow is a powerful intoxicant. It can be smoked as a concentrate or injected directly into the bloodstream. A creature subjected to a dose of black sap cannot be charmed or frightened for 1d6 hours.
Entries2: For each dose of black sap consumed, a creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 2d4 hours—an effect that is cumulative with multiple doses.

Name: Blight Ichor
Entries1: This bitter chartreuse concoction is distilled from a fungus native to the Blightshore badlands. The sickly green liqueur harbors potent psychedelic properties. Provided it is neither a construct nor undead, a creature subjected to a dose of blight ichor gains advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom checks, as well as vulnerability to psychic damage, for 1 hour. For each dose of blight ichor consumed, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1d6 hours and suffer the effects of a confusion spell for 1 minute. An undead creature subjected to a dose of blight ichor gains advantage on all Dexterity checks and is immune to the frightened condition for 1 hour.

Name: Murgaxor's Elixir of Life
Entries1: Whoever drinks this concoction gains advantage on death saving throws for 24 hours.

Name: Muroosa Balm
Entries1: This paste made from the muroosa bush is known to help prevent sunburn, but it is also a fire retardant. After spending 1 minute applying a quarter pint of muroosa balm to your skin, you gain resistance against fire damage for 1 hour.

Name: Olisuba Leaf
Entries1: These dried leaves of the Olisuba tree, when steeped to make a tea, can help a body recover from strenuous activity. If you drink a dose of Olisuba tea during a long rest, your exhaustion level is reduced by 2 instead of 1 at the end of that long rest.

Name: Potion of healing
Entries1: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

Name: Soothsalts
Entries1: Soothsalts are derived from a naturally occurring crystalline substance discovered throughout the wilds of the Miskath Strand. The crimson crystals have been mined from cavernous veins like those in the mouth of the Miskath Pit and found within smaller geode formations near sites ravaged by the Calamity. Soothsalts are consumed orally in lozenge-sized doses, and frequent users can be identified by the telltale crimson stain around their mouths. A creature subjected to a dose of soothsalts gains advantage on all Intelligence checks for 1d4 hours.
Entries2: For each dose of soothsalts consumed, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion—an effect which is cumulative with multiple doses.

Name: Theki Root
Entries1: This thick marsh root tastes bitter but is thought to aid digestive health. When you use an action to consume a dose, you gain advantage on saving throws against the effects of poisonous or toxic substances for 8 hours.

Name: Willowshade Oil
Entries1: A dark blue oil can be extracted from the rare fruit of the willowshade plant. A creature can use its action to apply the oil to another creature that has been petrified for less than 1 minute, causing the petrified condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature’s next turn.

Name: Poison, basic (vial)
Entries1: You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

Name: Blowgun
Entries1: Proficiency with a blowgun allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Dart
Entries1: Proficiency with a dart allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Hand Crossbow
Entries1: Proficiency with a hand crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Heavy Crossbow
Entries1: Proficiency with a heavy crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Light Crossbow
Entries1: Proficiency with a light crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Light Repeating Crossbow
Entries1: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

Name: Longbow
Entries1: Proficiency with a longbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Net
Entries1: Proficiency with a net allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.
Entries2: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

Name: Shortbow
Entries1: Proficiency with a shortbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Sling
Entries1: Proficiency with a sling allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Name: Shield
Entries1: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.
